definition:
A *promise problem* is a generalization of a decision problem. It is
defined by two decision problems $L_1$ and $L_2$ with
$L_1\cap L_2=\emptyset$. A Turing machine decides a promise problem if,
for any $x\in L_1\cup L_2$, it accepts when $x\in L_1$ and rejects if
$x\in L_2$. Behavior is undefined when $x\notin L_1\cup L_2$ (this is
the promise: that $x$ is in one of the two sets).

If $L_2=\Gamma^+\setminus L_1$ then this is just the decision problem
for $L_1$.
